vulnerabilities.description: Application config files are publicly accessible, causing information disclosure.
vulnerabilities.title: Information disclosure in config

vulnerabilities.description: Leaking configuration data at /config can give attackers insights into the system.
vulnerabilities.title: Config information disclosure

vulnerabilities.description: Attackers can achieve code execution on the server via /config if not patched.
vulnerabilities.title: Remote Code Execution at /config

vulnerabilities.description: Sensitive data in config is exposed, leading to information disclosure issues.
vulnerabilities.title: Public config leads to info disclosure

vulnerabilities.description: A critical misconfiguration in /config reveals sensitive credentials and secrets.
vulnerabilities.title: Misconfigured config endpoint

vulnerabilities.description: /session endpoint fails to renew session IDs. causing session fixation attacks.
vulnerabilities.title: Session fixation in session

vulnerabilities.description: Session fixation bug discovered in /session endpoint enables reusing another users session token.
vulnerabilities.title: Session fixation discovered

vulnerabilities.description: Session fixation in /session allows attackers to hijack valid sessions after login.
vulnerabilities.title: Session fixation vulnerability

vulnerabilities.description: A critical session fixation flaw in /session can compromise user accounts.
vulnerabilities.title: Session fixation flaw

vulnerabilities.description: Cart checkout page is susceptible to CSRF attacks through unprotected forms.
vulnerabilities.title: CSRF vulnerability in cart checkout

vulnerabilities.description: A CSRF vulnerability in the cart checkout flow can allow malicious form submissions.
vulnerabilities.title: CSRF in cart checkout

vulnerabilities.description: Reflected XSS discovered in profile endpoint, enabling malicious script execution.
vulnerabilities.title: Reflected XSS on user profile

vulnerabilities.description: The /profile endpoint can be exploited to run arbitrary commands on the server.
vulnerabilities.title: Remote code execution found at /profile

vulnerabilities.description: Profile authorization bypass could let normal user's access privileged info.
vulnerabilities.title: Profile authorization bypass

vulnerabilities.description: A Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) issue in the user profile page allows script injection.
vulnerabilities.title: XSS in user profile

vulnerabilities.description: Profile page is vulnerable to XSS if user-provided scripts are not sanitized.
vulnerabilities.title: Cross-Site Scripting in profile page

vulnerabilities.description: The /comments section is vulnerable to injection of arbitrary code via user content.
vulnerabilities.title: Comments injection flaw

vulnerabilities.description: Comment injection flaw at /comments endpoint allows attacker-supplied commands.
vulnerabilities.title: Comment injection in comments

vulnerabilities.description: SQL injection detected at the login endpoint. Possible to inject SQL commands.
vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection vulnerability (login)

vulnerabilities.description: Potential SQL injection vulnerability in the admin login flow, leading to database compromise.
vulnerabilities.title: Potential login SQL injection

vulnerabilities.description: An end-of-life Apache version is prone to server-side template injection attacks.
vulnerabilities.title: SSTI vulnerability in EOL Apache

vulnerabilities.description: Outdated Apache release allows server-side template injection if template engine is misconfigured.
vulnerabilities.title: Apache 2.2.9 with SSTI flaw

vulnerabilities.description: Obsolete version 2.2.x can be exploited via SSTI, leading to arbitrary code execution.
vulnerabilities.title: Obsolete Apache vulnerable to template injection

vulnerabilities.description: Apache 2.2.x is vulnerable to server-side template injection, potentially leading to RCE.
vulnerabilities.title: Server-Side Template Injection in old Apache

vulnerabilities.description: Malicious file upload possible if the upload endpoint is not validating file types.
vulnerabilities.title: Insecure file upload (upload endpoint)

vulnerabilities.description: A file upload flaw at /upload can be exploited to run arbitrary code on the server.
vulnerabilities.title: File upload flaw in endpoint

vulnerabilities.description: Attackers can upload arbitrary files via the upload endpoint, leading to RCE.
vulnerabilities.title: Arbitrary file upload vulnerability

vulnerabilities.description: The file upload endpoint accepts potentially harmful files without proper checks.
vulnerabilities.title: Unauthenticated file upload vulnerability

vulnerabilities.description: Encryption mechanism in /api/encrypt is weak. allowing potential data exposure.
vulnerabilities.title: Weak encryption in api encrypt

vulnerabilities.description: Lack of HSTS policy in the /secure endpoint leads to potential SSL stripping attacks.
vulnerabilities.title: Missing HSTS policy

vulnerabilities.description: Application accidentally exposes secret keys in the /secret route, allowing unauthorized access.
vulnerabilities.title: Secret key exposure

vulnerabilities.description: Malicious cache injection is possible in /assets, enabling attackers to serve rogue content.
vulnerabilities.title: Cache poisoning in /assets

vulnerabilities.description: An unclaimed subdomain can be taken over, letting attackers host malicious content.
vulnerabilities.title: Subdomain takeover vulnerability

vulnerabilities.description: Attackers can manipulate file paths to access unauthorized directories in /files endpoint.
vulnerabilities.title: Directory Traversal in files

vulnerabilities.description: CRLF injection discovered in the /headers endpoint, allowing partial HTTP response splitting.
vulnerabilities.title: CRLF injection in /headers
